bug.author: cpoptic
bug.summary: Jupyter Lab hangs when declaring WandB config variables
bug.description:
Weights and Biases version: '0.7.3' Python version: 3.6 Operating System:
<denchmark-h:h3>Description</denchmark-h>
Just trying to declare some hyperparameters in Jupyter Lab <denchmark-h:h3>What I Did</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-code>wandb.init() config = wandb.config </denchmark-code>
<denchmark-code>config.learning_rate = 0.1 config.mini_batch_size = 32 config.anneal_factor = 0.5 config.patience = 5 config.max_epochs = 1000 </denchmark-code>
While executing that 2nd cell, Jupyter Lab just hangs indefinitely. Curiously when I stop the kernel and run config, it returns a list of the odict keys that I assigned (learning_rate, mini_batch_size, etc). Jupyter keeps showing the asterisk, indicating that it's working, indefinitely.

comments.comment: Issue-Label Bot is automatically applying the label bug to this issue, with a confidence of 0.89. Please mark this comment with üëç or üëé to give our bot feedback! Links: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/marketplace/issue-label-bot>app homepage</denchmark-link> , <denchmark-link:https://mlbot.net/data/wandb/client>dashboard</denchmark-link> and <denchmark-link:https://github.com/hamelsmu/MLapp>code</denchmark-link> for this bot.
Thanks <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cpoptic>@cpoptic</denchmark-link> , I'll try to reproduce and get a fix ASAP.

Hey <denchmark-link:https://github.com/cpoptic>@cpoptic</denchmark-link> , I tried to reproduce this with the current version of the CLI 0.7.3 and couldn't. Here's a colab notebook (that should be using the same jupyter kernel backend): <denchmark-link:https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1cT3jyoEBmIQkGTX5H08exTk09fPyQ8Lx>https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1cT3jyoEBmIQkGTX5H08exTk09fPyQ8Lx</denchmark-link>
Can you create a notebook that can run in mybinder.org that could reproduce this?
We do serialize the dictionary as YAML when you set a key and write it to disk. Is it possible you have a funky yaml library or an issue writing to disk?
